required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Pre-existing Microalbuminuria Predicting Contrast-induced Acute Kidney Injury (CIAKI) Following Coronary Angiography (CAG)

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the association between pre-existing microalbuminuria and contrast-induced acute kidney injury (CIAKI) following coronary angiography (CAG).

primary_outcome.description: the difference of SCr before and after CAG.

primary_outcome.measure: number of participants with increase in SCr of at least 44.2 umol/L higher than before
primary_outcome.description: number of participants with the difference of SCr before and after CAG over 44.2 umol/L.

primary_outcome.measure: number of participants with increase of SCr over 25% higher than before
primary_outcome.description: number of participants with an increase of SCr over 25% higher than before.

secondary_outcome.measure: changes of urine albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR, mg/g)
secondary_outcome.description: the difference of ACR before and after CAG

arm_group.description: microalbuminuria group with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60ml/min.
normal-albuminuria group with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60ml/min.
microalbuminuria group with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <60ml/min.
normal-albuminuria group with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <60ml/min.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with eGFR ≥ 30 ml/min and without macroalbuminuria (defined as urine albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR) >300 mg/g) on admission are prepared to accept scheduled invasive coronary angiography during hospitalization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with eGFR≥30ml/min and without macroalbuminuria undergoing CAG.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Lactation
- Allergic history of contrast media
- Having been received contrast media within 7 days
- Use of nephrotoxic medications within 7 days
- eGFR <30 ml/min, macroalbuminuria (ACR >300 mg/g)
- Renal transplantation, emergent coronary angiography
- Cardiogenic shock, pulmonary edema
- Use of intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP) or mechanical ventilation
- Multiple myeloma and other malignant tumor
- Life expectancy less than 12 months

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University, Jiangsu Province Hospital

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University
